reply: The Issue isn't "bias". It's what they call "analysis". The news networks love to "break it down for you" , "tell you what this means to you" , "let the experts weigh in" and "hear from both sides of the aisle". And when they try to do those things they either have two people from each extreme of the argument scream at each other or the entire network goes full bore to one side or the other (fox and msnbc) just stop and think of how many articles about a new bill in congress get listed here and how many of those articles not once have ANY of the actual wording from the bill. never. Its just page after page(or minute after minute) of "The republicans want to poison our children with lead!" or "Obama wants to control the food supply!!" networks need to drop the "analysis" and go back to plain old hard facts.
title: Breaking news from America's number 1 fair and balanced news source
